text:
In its lightest moments, this film works as a solid buddy comedy. Omar Sy and François Cluzet have excellent comedic chemistry, which makes all of their loose hangout scenes pretty fun and amusing — the scene where Sy takes down classical music and the shaving sequence are particular standouts.

All attempts at genuine dramatic weight, however, fall completely flat. There is not nearly enough time dedicated to either character arc, so their problems never feel particularly pressing or real. The…
